description: The 'create_area_model' function generates a table as an area model, which is a key visualization tool in mathematics education. It is primarily used to teach multiplication and division, as well as fractions and decimals, by visually breaking down the values into rows and columns.
example_usage:
# Example usage for create_area_model
result = create_area_model(data)

stimulus_type_specification.title: Available Images: Area Model Tables
stimulus_type_specification.description: The images generated by this function are tables representing area models. These models are a visual representation of mathematical operations, particularly multiplication and division, as well as fractions and decimals. The tables are dynamically sized based on the input data, with the number of rows and columns corresponding to the dimensions of the area model. The cell content represents the data points of the model, and the headers provide context for the rows and columns. The images are designed to help students understand these mathematical concepts in a more intuitive and visual way.

details: The table is dynamically sized based on the input data.
The number of rows and columns correspond to the dimensions of the area model.
The cell content represents the data points of the model.
The headers provide context for the rows and columns.
The table is centered on the figure.
The font size is adjusted based on the cell width.
Extra spacing is added between the headers and data cells for clarity.

stimulus_type_specification.educational_purpose: The area model is a powerful tool in mathematics education, particularly for teaching multiplication and division, as well as fractions and decimals. By breaking down these operations into a visual format, students can better understand the underlying concepts and processes. This function allows educators to generate custom area models based on their specific teaching needs, providing a versatile tool for a variety of educational contexts.

educational_standards.description: Apply the distributive property as a strategy to multiply and divide whole numbers.
Identiy and use properties of operations to multiply or divide whole numbers.
Solve word problems that require multiplying 2-digit numbers by 2-digit numbers.

educational_standards.display_name: Setting Up Multiplication with Area Models
educational_standards.description: Represent a multi-digit multiplication as the area of a rectangle partitioned into smaller rectangles; label each partial area and add to obtain the full area (partial-products model).
Multiply 1-digit numbers by 2-digit numbers using area models.

educational_standards.display_name: Multiplying 2-Digit Numbers by 2-Digit Numbers Using Area Models
educational_standards.description: Multiply 2-digit numbers by 2-digit numbers using area models.

educational_standards.display_name: Multiply a 2-Digit Number by a 2-Digit Number
educational_standards.description: Multiply a 2-digit number by a 2-digit number.
Solve word problems that require multiplying 1-digit numbers by 2-digit or 3-digit numbers.
Divide 2-digit numbers by 1-digit numbers without remainders.
Multiply a decimal by a two-digit whole number using area models.

educational_standards.display_name: Decimal Addition and Subtraction Word Problems
educational_standards.description: Solve word problems involving additing and subtracting with decimal numbers.
Divide decimals to hundredths by a whole number.

educational_standards.display_name: Multiply with Mixed Numbers Area Models
educational_standards.description: Multiply mixed numbers by whole numbers and mixed numbers with mixed numbers with area models.
